intro: Ptychotis roxburghiana, commonly known as the Indian rock fig, is a climbing shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its milky sap and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fig-like fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
